abstract: “Dow Jones is a very viable company and The Wall Street Journal is a very viable newspaper,” Rupert Murdoch said in a phone interview with The New York Times.
snippet: “Dow Jones is a very viable company and The Wall Street Journal is a very viable newspaper,” Rupert Murdoch said in a phone interview with The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch went on a rare publicity blitz on Thursday to defend News Corporation’s decision to split the company’s newspapers from its entertainment assets.

headline.main: In a Morning Media Blitz, Murdoch Defends His Newspaper Assets
